446: Job Number: FAC348 Work Type: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Location: Murfreesboro, Tennessee Categories: Sciences Job Title Chemistry, Postdoctoral Research Assistant Department Chemistry University Expectation MTSU seeks candidates committed to innovative teaching and meaningful service. We also seek to attract culturally and academically diverse faculty who value working with diverse students. Salary Salary commensurate with education and experience Job Summary/Basic Function The Department of Chemistry at Middle Tennessee State University invites applicants for a postdoctoral research assistant position. This is a one-year temporary appointment with a possible annual renewal for up to four years, depending on the selected candidate's continued interest and performance and continued funding. The position is contingent upon funding and will begin once the successful candidate is hired. We seek individuals interested in contributing to developing the online platform for analyzing botanical compounds with mass spectrometry and developing professional skills for future positions in academia or non-academic settings. Successful candidates should have the desire to work in a collaborative, interdisciplinary, and cross-departmental team environment of professional staff, students, faculty, and administrators. The project's mission is to collect data for secondary metabolites from botanical materials, which will be used to develop an online database. The database will facilitate the authentication of known plant materials, identification of adulteration/contamination, help researchers analyze their samples quickly and reliably, facilitate chemical identification, and provide critical references to facilitate botanical dietary supplement research. Duties include but are not limited to designing and conducting research within a collaborative setting; analyzing qualitative and quantitative data; disseminating research findings at conferences and in referred journals; and developing partnerships with educators, organizations, and researchers to further the project's mission. The successful candidate will demonstrate the following: Experience in working with high-resolution mass spectrometry and chromatographic separation. Experience in collecting and analyzing large analytical metabolomic datasets and data mining approaches. Experience in the analysis of major food components such as secondary metabolites. Strong statistical, computational, and analytical skills. Strong oral and written communication skills. Practical knowledge of agricultural sciences, biology, or a similar field. Required Education A PhD or ABD (close to completion) in chemistry or food and agriculture sciences is required. Documents Needed to Apply To successfully apply, applicants must include the following documents as separate attachments at the time of online application submittal: a cover letter; curriculum vitae, which includes academic history, employment history, relevant experiences, and publication list; and Research Statement (as appropriate to the discipline). In addition, applicants must submit unofficial transcripts for their conferred doctorate degree. All documents submitted (including unofficial transcripts) must be in English or include a translation.
